Tom,

It's a pretty lousy MUNE-  I have another character in mind but haven't looked for it yet.  It is well-known that most signatures on kogatana are spurious, and IMHO these are no exception.  Elliot, I am sorry but it pains me to say that the characters are crudely chiselled with no finesse whatsoever.  A cursory run through my kogatana book does not reveal any examples signed in such a rudimentary manner.  I have found a Tadahiro but it is nothing like the piece under consideration.  I doubt there is much to learn from these pieces.  It always pays to bear in mind one of Albert Yamanaka's immortal sayings "Looking at bad swords ruins your eye".  It is no less true for kogatana...  But as Tom says, thanks for posting Elliot.  As a counter to Albert's advice, one of my truisms has always been "Look at everything"...

Regards,
Barry Thomas.

  ----- Original Message ----- 
  From: Tom Helm 
  To: nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com 
  Sent: Wednesday, March 28, 2007 3:56 PM
  Subject: Re: [nihontostudy] photos added to album


  Elliott -
  looks like quite a bit of the mei is missing but I would look at 
  Hitachi no Kami Muneshige of Settsu. Based on your photos that is my 
  best guess. I am also curious about the temper you mentioned, is it 
  only on the reverse? Can you show photos of the hamon for each of 
  these? might help confirm what the signature says...
  -t
  and thanks for posting.

  On Mar 27, 2007, at 7:03 PM, Elliott wrote:

  > Please go to second page of my album. I have two pictures of each; the
  > one in question and the Tadahiro kogatana.
  >
  > I am open to all comments, especially if you can decipher the one I
  > can't find. All I can hope for is that I purchased something that is
  > old and I can learn from.
  >
  > Thanks for your help, you guys are great.
  >
  > Elliott
  .
